title: Meghan Markle could see sales rise by giving Kardashians wine, says expert
description: An expert believes that the duchess could see wine sales increase after the Kardashians received some As Ever wine and shared it on Instagram.
content:
Meghan Markle could see her As Ever wine sales increase after sending some to members of the Kardashian family, an expert has said. The Duchess of Sussex, 44, restocked her As Ever Napa Valley Rosé wine last week, much to the delight of her fans. This was also much to the delight of Kris Jenner, who posted on her Instagram that she had received some As Ever wine from Meghan. Another Kardashian to get their hands on the goods was Khloé Kardashian, Kris’ daughter. With the famous Kardashian family being well-known globally, one expert believes that Meghan could see sales increase as a result of the celebrities having her As Ever wine.

Speaking exclusively to Express.co.uk, brand and culture expert Nick Ede said that Meghan has used the “oldest trick in the book”. He said: “It looks like the Kardashian clan have all received wine from Meghan, as Kris Jenner posted today on her Instagram stories. “It’s good to see the world’s second most famous family supporting Meghan and her brand, for her it's great to see the Kardashians are supporting their Montecito neighbour and with their power and influence we should see sales of the wine continue to rise. “It’s the oldest trick in the book to gift celebrities and friends your products in the hope that they will post or repost. To have the seal of approval from Kris, who loves a rose, is great for the AS EVER brand as a whole and could be a sign of things to come.”

He continued: “This association is another positive step in the evolution of Meghan to become a celebrity influencer who can drive sales and maximise on her relationships to build her business.” Meghan’s latest restock of her As Ever wine has yet to sell out, leading to some believing that it is a sign of less success. However, Mr Ede previously told Express.co.uk that instead it is a “good thing” as it suggests the brand has resolved its stock issues, with every other launch selling out in just hours. He said: “I think it’s a good thing that the new wine drop hasn’t sold out yet – it shows that they have solved the problem with stock issues – no one wants to come and buy something that’s constantly sold out!”

keywords.name: her As Ever Napa Valley Rosé wine

summary: Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex, could see her As Ever wine sales increase after sending wine to members of the Kardashian family, according to an expert from the brand. This follows Meghan's recent restocking of her AsEver Napa Valley Rosé wine, which was also shared by Kris Jenner, Khloe Kardashian, and Kate Middleton. Brand and Culture expert Nick Ede believes that this association could help Meghan become a celebrity influencer who can drive sales and enhance her business. The expert also suggested that Meghan may see sales increase due to the recognition of the celebrity support of her brand.
shortSummary: Meghan Markle may boost As Ever sales by sending gifts to members of the Kardashian family, boosting their influence as a celebrity influencer.

argos_summary: Meghan Markle's wine brand, As Ever, may see a boost in sales after she gifted bottles to members of the Kardashian family, including Kris and Khloé Kardashian. Brand expert Nick Ede noted that this strategy of celebrity gifting could enhance her brand's visibility and sales, especially with Kris Jenner's endorsement. Despite concerns about the latest wine restock not selling out quickly, Ede suggests this indicates improved stock management for the brand.
